metadata.title: CVE-2022-48795 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:parisc: Fix data TLB miss in sba_unmap_sgRolf Eike Beer reported the following bug:[1274934.746891] Bad Address (null pointer deref?): Code=15 (Data TLB missfault) at addr 0000004140000018[1274934.746891] CPU: 3 PID: 5549 Comm: cmake Not tainted5.15.4-gentoo-parisc64 #4[1274934.746891] Hardware name: sba_unmap_sg+0xac/0x118[1274934.746891] Backtrace:[1274934.746891]  [<00000000402740cc>] dma_unmap_sg_attrs+0x6c/0x70[1274934.746891]  [<000000004074d6bc>] scsi_dma_unmap+0x54/0x60[1274934.746891]  [<00000000407a3488>] mptscsih_io_done+0x150/0xd70[1274934.746891]  [<0000000040798600>] mpt_interrupt+0x168/0xa68[1274934.746891]  [<0000000040255a48>] __handle_irq_event_percpu+0xc8/0x278[1274934.746891]  [<0000000040255c34>] handle_irq_event_percpu+0x3c/0xd8[1274934.746891]  [<000000004025ecb4>] handle_percpu_irq+0xb4/0xf0[1274934.746891]  [<00000000402548e0>] generic_handle_irq+0x50/0x70[1274934.746891]  [<000000004019a254>] call_on_stack+0x18/0x24[1274934.746891][1274934.746891] Kernel panic - not syncing: Bad Address (null pointerderef?)The bug is caused by overrunning the sglist and incorrectly testingsg_dma_len(sglist) before nents. Normally this doesn't cause a crash,but in this case sglist crossed a page boundary. This occurs in thefollowing code:	while (sg_dma_len(sglist) && nents--) {The fix is simply to test nents first and move the decrement of nentsinto the loop.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
